item.title: Sci-fi FPS Moon Mystery heads to PS5 and Xbox Series XS on September 18th
item.content:encoded:
Cosmoscouts and Indie.io have announced that the sci-fi FPS Moon Mystery is coming to consoles nearly a year after it released for PC. Publisher indie.io has stated that Moon Mystery will be available from September 18th on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S, with the game being priced at $19.99. It is available to pre-order on the Microsoft store now, and available to wishlist on the PlayStation Store.

In Moon Mystery you play as Sam, an astrobiologist who is alone on the Moon aside from AI assistant TOBY. Sam becomes stranded on the Moon after all contact with Earth is lost, prompting him to find out the cause of the issue. It soon turns out that Sam is not alone on the lunar surface, so needs to run, gun, explore, and use his head to solve puzzles to get out of this predicament. The Moon is not the only location that Sam will end up exploring, as he travels to alien planets and an orbital city.

We did not review Moon Mystery, but the game is currently sitting on mixed reviews on Steam, though recent user reviews are a bit more positive.

Source: Press Release



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/09/08/sci-fi-fps-moon-mystery-heads-to-ps5-and-xbox-series-xs-on-september-18th/
